title: Malawi: Malawian Girls Tipped On Entrepreneurship
text:
Malawian Girls Tipped On Entrepreneurship Tagged: Botswana: Gender Inequity Needs to Be Eliminated - Goya 
Local entrepreneurs in Malawi have called on girls to be developing ideas that will see them be economically independent in the wake of skyrocketing unemployment levels in the country. 
Speaking at a Girls Scholar Retreat in Blantyre one of the entrepreneurs Peter Yakobe said that it is worrisome to note that most girls, who also are of a higher population, remain unemployed but have the capacity to develop on their own. 
" Unemployment rate is very high in Malawi, thousands of graduates are just moving around with papers with no hope of been employed, so whatever chances we have we should make use of those and after time will see that we have achieved something that can bring change to others" said Yakobe. Related Topics Botswana: Gender Inequity Needs to Be Eliminated - Goya 
He further urged girls in the country to desist in any kind of behaviours that may see them fail reach their goals as far as entrepreneurship is concerned. 
Education Manager for South-West Division, Ruth Kambali disclosed that government is putting in measures to empower girls in country. 
"There is a saying that 'If you educate a girl child you have educated the nation', picking it from that corner I hope that if more girls can be entrepreneurs they can bring a great change in this country" said Kambali. 
The three days retreat sponsored by Age Africa was meant to help girls in country through career talks and interaction with entrepreneurs. Malawi
